content: Meeting shortly (in a few minutes). Primary focus on release retrospective, I believe, I also want to check in on release notes writing for the upcoming release (I think @XAMPPRocky is on semi-vacation, so we should assign someone else.)
I guess probably Crater run+triage as well.
@T-release meeting!
Alright, well, since we're going to be in gathering mode for the first bit, let's get started -- things of note (good and bad!) for this release
• bump-stage0 is pretty great, really enjoyed not running a +/- 1 dance with the beta date

I didn't really have anything else of note, I think. Did anyone notice something that went poorly?

@triagebot end-topic if not...

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
oh, thanks for walking me through crater triage
that went pretty smoothly, I think :)
ok
well, ok, moving on
Release notes
Is anyone able to commit to writing the first set up? I think we'd start with https://github.com/rust-lang/relnotes, though it uses dates not milestones so sometimes misses/miscategorizes things
I might take a stab at it, I've been meaning to take a look at the generator here to see if we can shift it to milestone usage anyway
But happy to have someone else do it, of course. Alright, next up crater
@tmandry Would you like to commit to kicking off crater this cycle? It's mostly just copy/pasting the commands from 1.55 crater run into a new issue with date adjustments
sure
Ok, and then we can follow up on triage. I'm not sure I can do it next week -- do we have someone up for volunteering for that?
just to double check, is that blocked on anything or can I kick it off today?
No, can be kicked off today.
OK -- looks like no volunteers just now for crater, so I'll probably do it this cycle, and maybe we can start a 2-person rotation @tmandry (you do next cycle) for now?
that seems reasonable
this would also align with you mark not doing the crater triage on the same cycle as driving the release
(I can commit to driving this release)
I was going to say, next week is pretty busy for me also, but I don't mind taking a look in general, just might end up stacked behind some other things and I don't want to take too long
ah, I suppose (it's sort of an inverse alignment since the two are closely tied in weeks)
anyway, we can figure it out
OK, the last thing is the 1.56 blog post
will that be mostly focused on the edition?

Is anyone interested in writing it? It'll obviously include an announcement of the edition, which I expect @Mara is probably interested in helping out with :)

But that shouldn't be the whole announcement, as we're intentionally trying to make it seem "small"
(and, well, it sort of is)
Once we have release notes generated there's likely a better sense of what else to call out, I think
I can take this one if nobody else is interested
OK, sounds good -- we can try to arrive at topics next week, I think, presuming I get release notes done by then
okay, great
@triagebot end-meeting then, I think?

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
(@Pietro Albini @tmandry ^)
ok, thanks all.
:wave:
:wave: .

simulacrum said:

as we're intentionally trying to make it seem "small"

well we don't have to make it smaller than it is.
